reasoning: The test expected input validation to block script tags, but the application uses output encoding for XSS prevention instead. Screenshot 2 clearly shows the script tag is HTML-encoded (<SCRIPT> not <script>), which is a valid and equally effective security approach.
evidence_summary: Screenshot 1 shows script tag entered as page name. Screenshot 2 shows the page was created BUT the script tag is properly HTML-encoded in the navigation bar as <SCRIPT>ALERT('XSS')</SCRIPT>, meaning XSS is actually being prevented through output encoding rather than input validation.
scenario_id: Evoq.PersonaBar.Pages::Page Validation::Test special characters in page name (XSS prevention)
